central_thesis: This thesis elucidates the meaning of DEITUS as the Word of the Aeon of Lucifer and the Law of THELEMA, XEPER, DEITUS (Will to Come Into Being as a God). It serves as a commentary on the Demonic Bible and an exposition on deitic philosophy and magic, building upon Thelemic and Setian concepts to guide the practitioner towards personal apotheosis and the realization of inherent divinity.

structure_content.chapter_title: Introduction to Deitic Philosophy and Magic
structure_content.summary: The thesis introduces its purpose: to define DEITUS as the core principle of the Aeon of Lucifer, explaining it through the Demonic Bible, insights from the author's Guardian Demon Azael, and the Embassy of Lucifer. It posits deitic magic as a synthesis rooted in Thelemic, Setian, and O.N.A. traditions, emphasizing THELEMA and XEPER as paths to DEITUS.

structure_content.chapter_title: Basic Precepts of Satanic Belief and Ethics
structure_content.summary: Satanic belief is presented as the realization that all gods, religions, and holy texts are human creations. Satan is an archetype of carnality and ego, not a worshipped deity. The philosophy emphasizes self-interest, healthy ego development, critical questioning, and rejection of hypocrisy in traditional religions. Ethical behavior is dictated by self-preservation and adherence to man-made laws, not absolute good or evil.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Nature and Practice of Satanic Magic
structure_content.summary: Magic is defined as the human mind's ability to effect change in the natural world, encompassing telepathy, psychokinesis, and emotional energy release. Satanic rituals focus the mind and direct energy. Traditional grimoire practices are criticized for leading to delusion and insanity due to demands for visible spirit appearances. Spirits are understood as archetypal forms within the subconscious, existing to serve the magician's will.

The 'Map of the Spheres' from the Demonic Bible details archetypal realms (elemental, planetary, fixed stars, Zodiac, heavenly, Hades, Tartaran Abode, Chaos). Spirits, demons, and angels reside in these spheres as archetypes. The Aeonic Sphere, beyond the heavenly, is seen as closest to the universal subconscious. Aeons are cycles of expansion or restriction, with current aeons (Horus, Set, Lucifer) building upon each other as part of a larger expansion cycle.

structure_content.chapter_title: Evolution of Consciousness and Aeonic Words
structure_content.summary: The universal subconscious is termed 'God' (passive), while the dynamic consciousness is 'Satan' (active). These interact to create cycles of expansion and restriction, influencing humanity's growth. Key Aeonic Words like THELEMA (Horus, True Will), XEPER (Set, to become/expand consciousness), RUNA (unknowable), REMANIFEST (synthesis), and XEM (to be/I AM) are discussed. XEPER united with THELEMA forms 'Will to Become'.

DEITUS represents the ultimate goal: man's realization of having become God, the 'rise of Lucifer,' the conquest of heavens, and the return of the 'Ancient Ones' (primordial power within man). This involves rejecting past religions and moralities to assume responsibility as a god, acting with wisdom, power, and majesty. Practitioners are encouraged to become unique, powerful beings akin to ancient gods, governed by their own laws, embodying 'Will to Come into Being as a God'.

key_concepts.definition: The Word of the Aeon of Lucifer, signifying 'Will to Come Into Being as a God.' It represents the ultimate aim of man's spiritual evolution: the complete expansion of consciousness and recognition of personal divinity. It completes an 'Unholy Trinity' with Will (THELEMA) and expansion of consciousness (XEPER).

The Word of the Aeon of Horus, referring to the magician's true will or higher magical self. It implies following one's unique predetermined course ('Every man and every woman is a star') and is encapsulated by 'Do what thou will shall be the whole of the Law.'

The Word of the Aeon of Set, meaning 'to become' or 'to come into being.' It signifies the continuous expansion of consciousness to new levels of awareness and understanding through a dialectic process. When combined with THELEMA, it means 'Will to Become,' accelerating consciousness expansion through magical will.

A philosophical and magical system that views all gods as human creations and Satan as an archetype of carnality and the dynamic consciousness of the universe. It advocates self-deification, ego development, questioning all authority, and using magic for personal power and knowledge, rejecting worship of external deities.

A historical and spiritual epoch or cycle of human consciousness, each marked by a specific 'Word' and 'Law.' Aeons follow patterns of restriction and expansion. Examples include the Aeon of Isis, Osiris, Horus, Set, and Lucifer, which build upon one another within a current cycle of expansion.

Referred to as 'God,' it is the ocean of source consciousness shared by all humanity, from which conscious thought arises. It is generally passive, acted upon by the dynamic consciousness, and suffers from 'neuroses' due to millennia of 'isolation'.

Referred to as the 'Devil' or 'Satan,' it is the active, dynamic force that guides and directs the universe. It is compared to a river violently penetrating the ocean of the universal subconscious, driving change and expansion.

Magic is the human mind's ability to cause change in situations according to one's will, requiring unbending will, intense desire, and absolute faith. 'Lesser Magic' is the direct application of will without ritual, while 'Greater Magic' involves ritual invocation of spirits for knowledge and power, aiming for identification with spirits rather than commanding them for mundane desires.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is 'deitic magic,' a method for achieving DEITUS through the application of magical Will (THELEMA) to expand consciousness (XEPER). It involves a deep understanding of the self as a nascent god, rejecting external deities and traditional morality. Magic is categorized into 'Lesser Magic' (direct application of will in daily life) and 'Greater Magic' (ritual invocation of archetypal spirits). The purpose of Greater Magic is not to command spirits for mundane desires or visible manifestations, but to identify with these archetypes to gain knowledge and power, enhancing personal transformation towards self-deification. The system emphasizes self-responsibility, long-term goal setting, and the continuous expansion of awareness as the path to becoming a living god.
tools: The human mind: The primary tool for magic, telepathic transmissions, magnetism, psychokinesis, and emotional energy release.
Unbending Will (THELEMA): Crucial for success in magic and for directing consciousness expansion.
Intense emotional desire and absolute faith: Essential components for effective magical work.
Demonic Bible: Serves as a foundational guide and commentary for deitic magic and philosophy.
Understanding of archetypal spheres and spirits: Knowledge of these subjective realms and beings is key for effective invocation and self-identification.
Proper timing, imagery, balance, direction, and secrecy: Elements necessary for the successful performance of magical activities.
rituals: Satanic rituals: Performed to focus the mind and direct the flow of energy.
Lesser Magic: Direct application of the Will to subtly influence events or situations in the natural world without formal ceremony.

Greater Magic: Invocation of archetypal spirits (devils, demons, dark gods) for increasing knowledge and power through identification with the spirits. This is done to become more like the invoked spirit, not to command it for mundane desires. Rituals of destruction or compassion are rare exceptions, used only to enhance Lesser Magic, never replace it.

Invocation of archetypal devils, demons, and dark gods: Wording, sigils, or seals are not essential; the name represents a unique archetypal being for the magician to identify with and effect psychic changes.

relevant_quotes.text: The purpose of this thesis is to elucidate upon the meaning and significance of the Word of the Aeon of Lucifer, DEITUS, and the Law of the Aeon of Lucifer, THELEMA, XEPER, DEITUS or Will to Come Into Being as a God.

The Satanist says, “Why worship a god someone else has created, and which represents someone else's ego, when you can recognize a god of your own creation... a god which has your best interests at heart.”
Magic is the effect of the human mind to change events or situations in accordance with one's desire.
The Satanist does not worship Satan, but he chooses Satan as an archetype of carnality.
The Word DEITUS completes an Unholy Trinity: the Will, the expansion of consciousness, and personal divinity.
The Law of the Aeon of Lucifer is 'Will to Come into Being as a God.'
The realization of DEITUS is the recognition that man has become a God.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant within contemporary Western Esotericism, specifically for its contribution to modern Satanic and Luciferian currents. It synthesizes and evolves concepts from foundational figures like Crowley (Thelema) and LaVey/Aquino (Setianism), providing a cohesive philosophical framework for self-deification. By recontextualizing 'God' as the universal subconscious and 'Satan' as the dynamic consciousness, it offers a non-theistic yet deeply spiritual path to personal power and awareness, addressing the practitioner's journey from novice to 'God' within an expansive evolutionary cycle of consciousness. It critiques traditional religious and magical paradigms, advocating for an ego-driven, self-responsible approach to magical practice.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of experienced practitioners and advanced students of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Thelema, Setianism, Luciferianism, Chaos Magic, and related paths focused on self-actualization and apotheosis. It is suited for individuals who are critical of traditional religious dogma, engaged in deep philosophical inquiry into consciousness and reality, and seeking a practical magical system for personal transformation and power rather than external worship or intervention. The text assumes familiarity with occult terminology and historical figures in these traditions.
